lead_paragraph: The Islamic State’s suicide attack in Baghdad this month, officials say, foreshadows the violence it will unleash as it reverts to its guerrilla roots.

byline.contributor: Michael Schmidt reported from Baghdad and Washington, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Baghdad.
byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ERIC SCHMITT

headline.print_headline: U.S. and Iraq Are Set for ISIS to Dig Itself In
headline.main: As ISIS Loosens Grip, U.S. and Iraq Prepare for Grinding Insurgency

snippet: The Islamic State’s suicide attack in Baghdad this month, officials say, foreshadows the violence it will unleash as it reverts to its guerrilla roots....
abstract: Officials warn that many Islamic State fighters who lost battles in Iraq have blended back into Sunni civilian populations in Falluja and Ramadi and are biding their time to conduct future terrorist attacks; situation poses first major challenge to next American president, who will take office in January 2017.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
